NaturalDocs::TopicsTools

This package contains functions that can be used to modify %parsedFiles.  This has been implemented in order to add more options to NaturalDocs, such as showing parents functions in a class documentation, or sorting topics.

Summary
NaturalDocs::TopicsToolsThis package contains functions that can be used to modify %parsedFiles.
Constants
MAX_FUNCTIONSThis constant is used to separate functions by their first letter, if there are more than MAX_FUNCTIONS in the same group
Interface Functions
WorkOnParsedFilesThis method is an interface method that can be used to format parsedFiles the way we want.
Inheritance Functions
AddParentsMethodsThis method adds to every class in the current parsedFiles all inherited methods from all their known parents (grand-parents, and so on...)
SearchForParentsAndGetMethodsFor the given class, searches for parents and add their methods to @inheritedMethods May be called recursevely to get the whole “tree” of classes.
Sorting Functions
CountFunctionsAndJumpLinesFor the given class, if the number of function in a given group is over MAX_FUNCTIONS, we seperate by their first letter.
JumpLinesFor the given class, if the number of function in a given group is over MAX_FUNCTIONS, we seperate by their first letter.
SortByNameSorts every proprties / functions by name, inside any category they could be.
SortIndexesByNameFrom “startIndex” and until “endIndex”, sorts all elements of @parsedFile, first by their modifiers, and then alphabetically.
Support Functions
GetClasseNameFrom the given parsedFile, return the name of the classes it contains.

Constants

MAX_FUNCTIONS

my $MAX_FUNCTIONS

This constant is used to separate functions by their first letter, if there are more than MAX_FUNCTIONS in the same group

Interface Functions

WorkOnParsedFiles

sub WorkOnParsedFiles #(parsedFilesRef)

This method is an interface method that can be used to format parsedFiles the way we want.  In our case, it sorts topics, and adds parents classes.

Parameter

parsedFilesA reference to the hash containing all parsedFiles

Inheritance Functions

AddParentsMethods

sub AddParentsMethods #(parsedFilesRef)

This method adds to every class in the current parsedFiles all inherited methods from all their known parents (grand-parents, and so on...), and specifies from which parent they come from.  Those methods will be added at the end of the current parsedFile.

Parameter

parsedFilesA reference to the hash containing all parsedFiles

SearchForParentsAndGetMethods

sub SearchForParentsAndGetMethods #(className,
inheritedMethods,
topicClass,
parsedFiles,
file,
originalFile,
originalTopicClass);

For the given class, searches for parents and add their methods to @inheritedMethods May be called recursevely to get the whole “tree” of classes.

Parameters

classNameThe name of the class for which we’re looking for parents
inheritedMethodsAn array where we store inherited methods
topicClassThe topic containing className
parsedFilesA reference to the hash containing all parsedFiles
originalFileThe complete path to the file containing the class we were looking for its parents in the first place (used for recursion)
originalTopicClassThe topic containing the class we were looking for its parents in the first place

Sorting Functions

CountFunctionsAndJumpLines

sub CountFunctionsAndJumpLines #(parsedFile)

For the given class, if the number of function in a given group is over MAX_FUNCTIONS, we seperate by their first letter.

Parameters

  • parsedFile : A reference to the array containing all topics from the parsed file

JumpLines

sub JumpLines

For the given class, if the number of function in a given group is over MAX_FUNCTIONS, we seperate by their first letter.

Parameters

  • startIndex : The index from which you want to jump lines
  • endIndex : The index where you want to stop jumping lines
  • parsedFile : A reference to the array containing all topics from the parsed file
  • index : A reference to the current index of your parsedFile (it’s going to change since we’re adding groups)

SortByName

sub SortByName #(parsedFile)

Sorts every proprties / functions by name, inside any category they could be.

Parameters

  • parsedFile : A reference to the array containing all topics from the parsed file

SortIndexesByName

sub SortIndexesByName #(startIndex,
endIndex,
indexRef,
$parsedFile)

From “startIndex” and until “endIndex”, sorts all elements of @parsedFile, first by their modifiers, and then alphabetically.  Also creates a group for each new modifiers.

Parameters

  • startIndex : The index from which you want to sort by name
  • endIndex : The index where you want to stop sorting by name
  • index : A reference to the current index of your parsedFile (it’s going to change since we’re adding groups)
  • parsedFile : A reference to the array containing all topics from the parsed file

Support Functions

GetClasseName

sub GetClasseName #(parsedFile)

From the given parsedFile, return the name of the classes it contains.
